title: Peer Assessment Skill Development Course for Mathematics Research

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Focuses on iterative feedback training for current math educators to resolve practical issues in peer assessment processes. Utilizes online collaboration tools in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Apply at least three structured feedback frameworks to evaluate the methodological rigor and validity of results in mathematical research papers.
Achieve over 80% improvement in peer assessment by using a checklist for objective language and bias mitigation.
Achieve an inter-rater reliability score (ICC) of 0.7 or higher through at least three iterative feedback cycles.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
